phrases: How irresponsible.
You do not care if she dies or succeeds?
She will not die, and I do not intend to let her.
She was expensive, after all.
You can neither become human, nor return to being a fairy, you filthy creature.
Do you really think you will be forgiven for buying a human?
It seems you are still as much of a human supremacist as ever, Renfred.
Why do you know about Chise?
You have never liked auctions, have you?
That event is strictly private.
What happens there is to be kept secret.
Besides, what use do you have for this mass of human rage and regret?
I see.
Who took that arm of yours?
Good work, Chise.
Elias.
Flowers, huh?
You are safe!
That was clever.
Chise is not all about destruction the way you are.
He looks relieved.
Let us go, Alice.
Master...
Are you leaving?
You still have not told me anything.
The corruption is gone.
I have no further business here.
I do not care how you use the girl.
Be careful.
There are countless people interested in her.
You knew them?
That sorcerer is famous for his distaste for mages.
He is always liked picking fights with me.
He still had both of his arms the last time I saw him, though.
Something is going on.
Are you okay, Chise?
Her magical production circuits must be exhausted.
You can get some sleep.
Thank you.
Elias...
When am I going to die?
You had not forgotten, huh?
In three years, maybe, if nothing's done about it.
I have thought of a way to prevent it.
You do not have to worry.
Why did not you tell me?
Because there was no reason to.
Your death is not a part of my plans.
So your experiment is to see if you can keep me from dying?
Sure.
To see what will happen if I have a Sleigh Beggy around me, a reservoir of limitless magic.
But you do not need more magic, do you?
So, why me?
I am half-bakedneither human, fairy, nor spirit.
I have lived for a long, long time, and seen many humans,
but I still do not quite understand any of them, including you.
I can comprehend your thoughts,
but I cannot empathize.
I can understand the reasons behind your tears, anger, and laughter,
but I cannot make them my own.
I bought you because it was advantageous for me.
That is all.
Because you had nothing, and you could not part from the non-human that is me.
I let you hear the words that I suspected you would want to hear, and gave you shelter, food,
knowledge, and attention.
I thought I might learn something if I raised one of you myself.
I did plan on telling you after you would become completely attached to me.
It is strange.
Though I had to do it earlier, thanks to Renfred.
His facial expression does not change.
I know.
If you do not need this memory, I can destroy it for you.
Yet the glimmer in his eyes is like a child's.
There is no need to be scared.
Until you do not need me anymore...
I will stay by your...
side...
Look at that quality male, being confessed to by a female.
You have impressed me, mage.
I think she meant, You are so pathetic, I cannot just leave you.
She touched me for the first time.
It looks like you will finally have what you have sought, after your long journey.
I am glad for you.
Shall we return to our home, Chise?
Is this all for today?
Indeed, I hope she wakes up today.
Her breath and her pulse are stable.
It has not hurt her physically yet.
Chise may be more capable than I thought.
You are back, Simon?
At least let me worry about her.
Two weeks you have returned from Ulthar, and she is still not awake.
It is to be expected.
She is keeping her physical functions to a minimum,
so she can focus on replenishing the magic she used.
Recovery is faster in the forests or under water than in the city.
She will awaken soon.
I do not approve of you letting such a child be so reckless.
You are still hiding something, are not you?
You can tell, huh?
It is been ten years since I was assigned to keep an eye on you.
I can tell when your bony face is pale under your cloth.
Sing, sing, sing.
Ruffle, trees, in the wind,
let not the sunlight pass.
Dance, flowers and grass,
let not your scent be lost for direction.
Sing praise, homeless bird, that the mistress of the night
shall not tear off your wings.
Return to the earth, and sing,
flutter in the skies, and sing,
bow your head to the noble garden and sing,
for the great Gealach of Tir na nOg has arrived.
Well, well, two strapping young men to greet me.
How kind of you both.
My queen, you ought not speak directly with the commoners.
You are so strict.
He is one of my own, Spriggan.
I have no respect to show a being of flesh.
Who is she?
Try not to talk to her too much.
She is the Queen of Faeries.
She commands all of the creatures of the night in Britain.
Titania.
You are perhaps the only one besides my husband that calls me by my name, Thorn.
Where is the king?
He gets rambunctious, so I left him behind.
I wanted to see you and your hatchling today.
Oh?
You worship that foreign god.
You are called a priest, are you not?
Y-Yeah.
Yes, though the scent is faint...
Be gone.
That was uncivil.
He will merely wander the woods for a while.
I will return him after the hour of honey mead.
Now, Thorn, would you introduce me to your wife?
Wow, a redhead.
She will become a great mage.
Oberon...
What are you doing?
Shucks, you found me.
You were not even trying to hide.
Faerie King Oberon.
She is neither a toy nor a doll.
Stand back, please.
What, are you jealous?
You have finally come to that, huh?
I like it.
How manly.
The one who wears a she will of flesh...
Seeing change in a halfling like yourself is splendid.
You would only been watching from the shadows until now,
but you are trying to end your wandering by having a human nearby.
Watching you act as though you were her parent or mate is quite fun.
Although...
I wonder how long you can keep up your false kindness for this one person.
Ow, ow, ow!
You must not bully children, dear.
You are here to see his mate today, are not you?
You are so soft when it comes to kids, Titania.
Unfortunately, I am not as unscrupulous as you are.
You are so mean!
Fine.
Let us just hurry up and wake this sleepy-head.
Magic power.
I knew it.
Our robin is beautiful when she opens her eyes.
Good morning, sweet maid who bears the name of birds.
Did you have sweet dreams?
YOU-Uh...
Who are you?
Morning, Chise.
Elias.
Rejected.
A hatchling's imprinting sure is strong.
She just caught on to how terrible a person you are.
Um...
You were asleep for a while.
How do you feel?
Are you tired or in pain?
Uh, I am not.
Good.
Sorry to scare you.
Nice to meet you.
I am Titania, queen of all faeries who live in Albion as well as Tir na nOg
And I am her husband, Oberon!
Nice to meet you.
Albion?
Tir?
An old name for the island of Great Britain.
Tir na nOg is the land of fairies
Hey, girl, Chise, was it?
You are not afraid of him?
Are you okay?
Not distressed?
Sure.
Yes, I am fine.
Oh, yeah?
I am glad.
Yup.
As long as you are not scared.
So, do you have kids yet?
Huh?
You are married, are not you?
Maybe you are too little still.
I bet your child would be an excellent mage.
Kids are cute.
Especially blondes!
Seriously.
We really love blondes.
Spriggan.
Go.
Ow, ow, ow!
Not there, stop!
Ow, ow, ow!
I guess he is kind of really stupid.
Pay him no mind.
Do forgive my fool of a husband.
I-Is he all right?
Do not worry.
He is enjoying it.
No!
Oh.
He is one of those people.
Kids?
By kids, does he mean...
Is something the matter?
No.
It is nothing.
Elias?
Nothing, my gut just...
I do not know.
Oh dear, oh dear.
This good-for-nothing makes himself useful once in a while.
I will be excusing myself now, especially since this idiot is here.
We will talk another time.
I am glad I got to meet the hatchling mage.
Come visit us someday.
We will hold a banquet.
I will go, if you intend to let us come home.
We will see.
Every being of the night, including she and you, are my adorable little children.
Well then, good day.
Toodles!
Do not you dare think of setting foot there, even if the queen allows it.
It is no place for a half-baked creature with a she will of flesh.
Those with shells bring only calamity.
I know.
I would never ask to be invited.
Elias?
You sure are harsh to everyone that is not a fairy.
Damn shelled being...
Think of all the people and spirits that were lost because of him.
The humans were guilty back then.
It is always those of us in the humans' shadows that get the short end of the stick.
Well, then, why do not we bet on whether or not it will work out between those two, Titania?
Far wiser to bet on the number of children.
True.
I am finally out of the forest.
Fairy magic is such a pain.
Simon-san.
Chise-kun!
You are finally awake.
We were worried about you.
Sorry.
Shoot, the sisters are going to yell at me.
I will be going now.
Too bad I cannot stay for dinner.
Are you really my watchdog?
I am kidding.
Well, then, Chise-kun, take care of yourself.
He is a good person.
He is just stupid.
He has not changed at all in ten years.
Ten years...
I wish you would bought me ten years ago.
Even though we are going to be spending far more than ten years going forward?
I hope your experiment succeeds.
It will.
Will it?
We will make it.
Now, Silver is waiting.
Let us go home.
What is this?
It is out of season, but it is a Christmas pudding.
She is aged it since the day you came home.
It is good.
Isabelle...
The girl and the mage set out to fulfill their final task.
The sorcerer Joseph's schemes are set in motion in pursuit of the masterless black dog.
Do not mess up next time.
